body.p:
1
To his Excellency James F Robinson, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Your petitioner James E Brookover resident in the city of Maysville in the state of Kentucky represents that at the last July Term of the Mason Circuit Court, he was fined the sum of fifty dollars for 'selling liquor to a slave, such was the 'Character' of the Indictment and the ruling and opinion of the Court upon a Demurrer thereto as to preclude him from making any successful defense thereto -- It was proved that upon one occasion liquor was sold to a negro, but whether he was a slave witness did not know, nor was there any allegation in the Indictment as to where if a slave to whom he belonged -- he annexes hereto a copy of the indictment and although he may appeal from the Judgement, yet he hopes your Excellency will take under the circumstances it a fit case for executive clemency and remit said fine which he respectfully solicits you to do
The undersigned concer and unite in the prayer of the above petition

Jno D Taylor
Keith Berry
J G Hickaman
George Brough
Jas P. Poyer
J. Ravencroft
H McCollough
Alfred Finistoe
Stevin.B. Reese

Jas. C. Bremer Pettn to remit fine
Examd Pettn refused
J F Robinson
